sentences.text: The '''2025 FIFA Futsal Women's World Cup''' is the planned inaugural edition of the FIFA Futsal Women's World Cup, an international futsal competition organized by FIFA. The inaugural edition is to be hosted in the Philippines from November 21 to December 7.

references.text: <ref name=abs-fifa-pff-prep>{{cite news |last1=Agcaoili |first1=Nicole |title=FIFA, PFF prep for Futsal Women's World Cup |url=https://news.abs-cbn.com/sports/2024/6/14/fifa-pff-prep-for-futsal-women-s-world-cup-2013 |access-date=14 June 2024 |work=ABS-CBN News |date=14 June 2024}}</ref>

<ref>{{cite web |title=FIFA Council takes key decisions on FIFA Member Associations and upcoming FIFA competitions |url=https://inside.fifa.com/about-fifa/organisation/fifa-council/media-releases/fifa-council-takes-key-decisions-member-associations-upcoming-competitions |website=Inside FIFA |publisher=FIFA |access-date=4 October 2024 |date=3 October 2024}}</ref>

sentences.text: The World Cup was first announced by FIFA in December 2022. This was followed by countries expressing their interests to host, including Finland.

references.text: <ref>{{cite web |title=Naiset saavat vihdoin omat futsalin MM-kisat |trans-title=Women finally get their own Futsal World Cup - "It brings a smile to my face" |url=https://www.palloliitto.fi/ajankohtaista/naiset-saavat-vihdoin-omat-futsalin-mm-kisat-se-tuo-hymyn-huulilleni |access-date=4 June 2024 |website=Palloliitto.fi |publisher=Football Association of Finland |language=fi |quote=Laitinen mm. väläyttelee, että Suomi voisi harkita ensimmäisten MM-kisojen järjestäjän oikeutta.}}</ref>

sentences.text: On May 15, 2024, the Philippines was given the hosting rights,  beating other bidding nations which include Brazil, Italy, and Spain. The List of indoor arenas in the Philippines|indoor arenas in the Philippines and its successful organization of the 2023 FIBA Basketball World Cup were cited as reasons for the selection.

references.text: <ref name="FIFA-2024-05-15a">{{cite press release |title=FIFA Council approves Women's International Match Calendar 2026-2029 |date=15 May 2024 |publisher=FIFA |url=https://inside.fifa.com/about-fifa/organisation/fifa-council/media-releases/fifa-council-approves-womens-international-match-calendar-2026-2029 |accessdate=15 May 2024}}</ref>

<ref name="dugout-ph-to-host">{{cite news |date=15 May 2024 |title=PH to host 1st FIFA Women's Futsal World Cup |url=https://www.dugout.ph/2024/05/philippines-to-host-first-fifa-womens.html |access-date=4 June 2024 |work=Dugout Philippines}}</ref>

sentences.text: Alongside the host Philippines women's national futsal team|Philippines, the inaugural 2025 Futsal Women's World Cup will feature 3 teams from Asia (Asian Football Confederation|AFC), 2 each from Africa (Confederation of African Football|CAF) and North/Central America (CONCACAF), 3 from South America (CONMEBOL), 1 from Oceania (Oceania Football Confederation|OFC), and 4 qualifiers from Europe (UEFA). 80 teams along with the host of 211 FIFA members, have participated in the qualification.

<ref name=abs-fifa-pff-prep/> As of January 2024, there are two FIFA-approved venues as per the PFF; the venues in Pasig and Victorias were approved by FIFA.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Terrado |first1=Reuben |title=Pasig, Victorias to host FIFA Women's Futsal World Cup games |url=https://www.spin.ph/football/fifa/pasig-victorias-host-matches-of-the-fifa-women-s-futsal-world-cup-a795-20250108 |access-date=9 January 2025 |work=Sports Interactive Network Philippines |date=9 January 2025 |language=en}}</ref>

sentences.text: PhilSports Arena in Pasig is being considered as the venue for the knock-out stage. Reportedly, the Mall of Asia Arena in Pasay, the Smart Araneta Coliseum in Quezon City and the Ninoy Aquino Stadium in Manila were also being considered. and Iloilo City.
